org.rdkit.knime.util

Class SettingsUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.util.SettingsUtils

  • public class SettingsUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class offers several utility methods to deal with KNIME settings objects.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Method Detail

      • getNodeName

        public static java.lang.String getNodeName(ConfigRO settings)
        Determines the node name based on a settings object.
        Parameters:
        settings - Settings of a node.
        Returns:
        The node name contained in the settings or null, if not found.

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(java.lang.Object o1,
                             java.lang.Object o2)
        This method compares two objects and considers also the value null. If the objects are both not null, equals is called for o1 with o2.
        Parameters:
        o1 - The first object to compare. Can be null.
        o2 - The second object to compare. Can be null.
        Returns:
        True, if the two objects are equal. Also true, if both objects are null.

      • autoGuessColumn

        public static boolean autoGuessColumn(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                      SettingsModelString settingColumn,
                                      java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> valueClass,
                                      int indexOfFindingsToBeUsed,
                                      java.lang.String strWarningIfMoreThanOneAvailable,
                                      java.lang.String strErrorIfNotFound,
                                      WarningConsolidator warningConsolidator)
                               throws InvalidSettingsException
        Auto guesses based on the passed in table specification the name of a column based on its data value type. It only changes the specified settings object, if there are no settings yet.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification containing column specifications. Must not be null.
        settingColumn - A setting model standing for a column name. Must not be null.
        valueClass - The desired value class for the column compatibility check. Must not be null.
        indexOfFindingsToBeUsed - The index to be used if more than 1 column is found. Important: This index is zero-based. Usually you would specify 0 here.
        strWarningIfMoreThanOneAvailable - If not set to null, this warning will be shown in case that multiple columns would have fit the desired column type. You may use the placeholder %COLUMN_NAME%, which will be replaced with the auto selected column name in the warning message. Can be null to omit a warning.
        strErrorIfNotFound - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no compatible columns were found and the setting could not be populated. Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method.
        warningConsolidator - Warning consolidator instance to add warnings to. Can be null.
        Returns:
        True, if the column was auto-determined or was already set before. False, if it could not be determined and the setting is still empty.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the last parameter is not null, and if no compatible column could be found.

      • autoGuessColumn

        public static boolean autoGuessColumn(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                      SettingsModelString settingColumn,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>> listValueClasses,
                                      int indexOfFindingsToBeUsed,
                                      java.lang.String strWarningIfMoreThanOneAvailable,
                                      java.lang.String strErrorIfNotFound,
                                      WarningConsolidator warningConsolidator)
                               throws InvalidSettingsException
        Auto guesses based on the passed in table specification the name of a column based on its data value type. It only changes the specified settings object, if there are no settings yet.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification containing column specifications. Must not be null.
        settingColumn - A setting model standing for a column name. Must not be null.
        listValueClasses - a list of acceptable value classes for the column compatibility check. Must not be null.
        indexOfFindingsToBeUsed - The index to be used if more than 1 column is found. Important: This index is zero-based. Usually you would specify 0 here.
        strWarningIfMoreThanOneAvailable - If not set to null, this warning will be shown in case that multiple columns would have fit the desired column type. You may use the placeholder %COLUMN_NAME%, which will be replaced with the auto selected column name in the warning message. Can be null to omit a warning.
        strErrorIfNotFound - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no compatible columns were found and the setting could not be populated. Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method.
        warningConsolidator - Warning consolidator instance to add warnings to. Can be null.
        Returns:
        True, if the column was auto-determined or was already set before. False, if it could not be determined and the setting is still empty.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the last parameter is not null, and if no compatible column could be found.

      • checkColumnExistence

        public static boolean checkColumnExistence(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                           SettingsModelString settingColumn,
                                           java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> valueClass,
                                           java.lang.String strErrorIfNotSet,
                                           java.lang.String strErrorIfNotFound)
                                    throws InvalidSettingsException
        Checks based on the passed in table specification if the column with the name represented in the passed in settings model exists and if it has the proper value class assigned.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification containing column specifications. Must not be null.
        settingColumn - A setting model standing for a column name. Must not be null.
        valueClass - The desired value class for the column compatibility check. Can be null to avoid the check.
        strErrorIfNotSet - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column name has been set yet (is null). Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method.
        strErrorIfNotFound - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column was found matching the passed in name. Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method. You may use the placeholder %COLUMN_NAME%, which will be replaced with the concrete column name that was not found.
        Returns:
        True, if the column name was found. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the last parameter is not null, and if the column could not be found or has is not compatible with the necessary data type (value class). Also thrown, if the second last parameter is not null, and if the column name had not been set yet.

      • checkColumnExistence

        public static boolean checkColumnExistence(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                           SettingsModelString settingColumn,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>> listValueClasses,
                                           java.lang.String strErrorIfNotSet,
                                           java.lang.String strErrorIfNotFound)
                                    throws InvalidSettingsException
        Checks based on the passed in table specification if the column with the name represented in the passed in settings model exists and if it has the proper value class assigned.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification containing column specifications. Must not be null.
        settingColumn - A setting model standing for a column name. If a SettingModelColumnName model is passed in, the method will also return true, if the option useRowID is checked. Must not be null.
        listValueClasses - A list of desired value classes for the column compatibility check. Can be null to avoid the check.
        strErrorIfNotSet - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column name has been set yet (is null). Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method.
        strErrorIfNotFound - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column was found matching the passed in name. Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method. You may use the placeholder %COLUMN_NAME%, which will be replaced with the concrete column name that was not found.
        Returns:
        True, if the column name was found. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the last parameter is not null, and if the column could not be found or has is not compatible with the necessary data type (value class). Also thrown, if the second last parameter is not null, and if the column name had not been set yet.

      • autoGuessColumnName

        public static java.lang.String autoGuessColumnName(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                                   java.lang.String[] arrMoreColumnNames,
                                                   java.lang.String[] arrExclColumnNames,
                                                   SettingsModelString settingNewColumnName,
                                                   java.lang.String strSuggestedName)
        Auto guesses based on the passed in table specification the name of a column based on its data value type. It only changes the specified settings object, if there are no settings yet.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification containing column specifications, which shall be considered in the uniqueness check. Must not be null.
        arrMoreColumnNames - Array of additional column names, which would exist in the new name space and should be considered for uniqueness check. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        arrExclColumnNames - Array of column names to exclude from the uniqueness check, e.g. because these columns will be removed. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        settingNewColumnName - The setting model of the new column name. Must not be null.
        strSuggestedName - The suggested name for the new column. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Resulting name which is unique considering the passed in parameters. If the column name was already set, it returns it but without checking it for uniqueness.

      • checkColumnNameUniqueness

        public static boolean checkColumnNameUniqueness(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                                java.lang.String[] arrMoreColumnNames,
                                                java.lang.String[] arrExclColumnNames,
                                                SettingsModelString settingNewColumnName,
                                                java.lang.String strErrorIfNotSet,
                                                java.lang.String strErrorIfNotUnique)
                                         throws InvalidSettingsException
        Determines based on the passed in table specification and column names, if the specified column name would cause a name conflict.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification containing column specifications, which shall be considered in the uniqueness check. Must not be null.
        arrMoreColumnNames - Array of additional column names, which would exist in the new name space and should be considered for uniqueness check. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        arrExclColumnNames - Array of column names to exclude from the uniqueness check, e.g. because these columns will be removed. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        settingNewColumnName - The setting model for the name of a new column that shall be checked for uniqueness. Must not be null.
        strErrorIfNotSet - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column name has been set yet (is null). Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method.
        strErrorIfNotUnique - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column was found matching the passed in name (name not unique). Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method. You may use the placeholder %COLUMN_NAME%, which will be replaced with the concrete column name that was not found.
        Returns:
        True, if the name is unique. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the last parameter is not null, and if the column name is not unique. Also thrown, if the second last parameter is not null, and if the column name had not been set yet.

      • checkColumnNameUniqueness

        public static boolean checkColumnNameUniqueness(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                                java.lang.String[] arrMoreColumnNames,
                                                java.lang.String[] arrExclColumnNames,
                                                java.lang.String strNewColumnName,
                                                java.lang.String strErrorIfNotSet,
                                                java.lang.String strErrorIfNotUnique)
                                         throws InvalidSettingsException
        Determines based on the passed in table specification and column names, if the specified column name would cause a name conflict.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification containing column specifications, which shall be considered in the uniqueness check. Must not be null.
        arrMoreColumnNames - Array of additional column names, which would exist in the new name space and should be considered for uniqueness check. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        arrExclColumnNames - Array of column names to exclude from the uniqueness check, e.g. because these columns will be removed. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        strNewColumnName - The name of a new column that shall be checked for uniqueness. Can be null, if not set yet, but results in an exception if the strErrorIfNotSet parameter is set.
        strErrorIfNotSet - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column name has been set yet (is null). Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method.
        strErrorIfNotUnique - If not set to null, this will be used as error message when no column was found matching the passed in name (name not unique). Set it to null, if no exception shall be thrown by this method. You may use the placeholder %COLUMN_NAME%, which will be replaced with the concrete column name that was not found.
        Returns:
        True, if the name is unique. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the last parameter is not null, and if the column name is not unique. Also thrown, if the second last parameter is not null, and if the column name had not been set yet.

      • makeColumnNameUnique

        public static java.lang.String makeColumnNameUnique(java.lang.String newColumnName,
                                                    DataTableSpec tableSpec,
                                                    java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> colNames)
        Creates a unique column name based on the passed in newName. It considers existing columns names, which must be passed in as existing table spec and/or string collection. If the new name does not exist yet, it is simply returned. If it exists, the method appends " (#...)" an increasing number until a unique name has been found.
        Parameters:
        newColumnName - The optimal new column name. Must not be null.
        tableSpec - Existing table spec of a table that will be merged. Can be null.
        colNames - Collection of existing column names. Can be null.
        Returns:
        A unified column name based on the passed in new name. Never null.

      • createMergedColumnNameList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> createMergedColumnNameList(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                                                          java.lang.String[] arrMoreColumnNames,
                                                                          java.lang.String[] arrExclColumnNames)
        Creates a list of strings taking all column names of the passed in table specification, merging it with the second parameter array and removing all occurrences of string passed in with the third parameter array.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - A table specification. Must not be null.
        arrMoreColumnNames - Array of additional column names, which would exist in the new name space and should be considered for uniqueness check. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        arrExclColumnNames - Array of column names to exclude from the uniqueness check, e.g. because these columns will be removed. Can be null. It is also ok, if some elements in the array are null - they will be ignored.
        Returns:
        Merged list.

      • getTableSpecs

        public static DataTableSpec[] getTableSpecs(DataTable[] arrTables)
        Creates an array of table specifications retrieved from the passed in array of tables.
        Parameters:
        arrTables - Array of tables. Can be null.
        Returns:
        Array of specifications of the passed in tables. Null, if null was passed in. Empty array, if an empty array was passed in. Elements are null for optional tables, which don't exist.

      • getEnumValueFromString

        public static <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> T getEnumValueFromString(java.lang.Class<T> enumType,
                                                                     java.lang.String valueAsString,
                                                                     T defaultValue)
        Determines the enumeration value based on a string. This string must match an enumeration name or toString() representation of the passed in enumeration class. If not, the default value will be used instead and a warning will be logged.
        Parameters:
        enumType - Enumeration class. Must not be null.
        valueAsString - The new value to store.
        defaultValue - Default enumeration value, if string cannot be recognized as any valid enumeration value.
        Returns:
        Enumeration value, if found. If not found, it will return the specified defaultValue. If null was passed in as string, it will return null.
